name: RenderX Web Orchestration
title: RenderX Web - Master Orchestration Pipeline
description: Six-movement orchestration managing the complete RenderX Web lifecycle: initialization, building, testing, validation, delivery, and monitoring. Coordinates build system, test execution (E2E Cypress), compliance validation, deployment pipeline, telemetry instrumentation, and recovery operations.
purpose: Provide centralized orchestration and governance for RenderX Web application ensuring coordinated build, test, validation, deployment, and operational monitoring across all integration points.
trigger: CI/CD pipeline initiation, code commit, or explicit deployment request

policies: Build system must pass pre-build-pipeline-check-symphony validation
E2E Cypress tests must maintain ≥ 85% pass rate
Compliance validation must complete with 0 critical violations
Delivery pipeline must orchestrate through pipeline-delivery-execute-symphony
Telemetry instrumentation must be collected via generate-telemetry-instrumentation-symphony
Recovery procedures must be available through pipeline-recovery-symphony
All operations subject to 37-beat enforcement pipeline

movements.name: Initialization
movements.description: Initialize RenderX Web build environment and dependencies
movements.userStory: As a UI system, I want to retrieve the current theme in <10ms so that theme application happens imperceptibly (target: <5ms for 95th percentile).
movements.businessValue: Enables instant theme switching; reduces user-perceived latency; supports dark mode preference with < 10ms detection

beats.name: resolve-theme
acceptanceCriteria:
Given the theme system is initialized
When getCurrentTheme is called
Then current theme (dark/light) is returned within 10ms
And theme preference from localStorage is respected
And default theme is applied if no preference exists

Given user has theme preference saved
When getCurrentTheme executes
Then saved preference is returned
And the response includes theme metadata (colors, fonts)
And no API calls are made (cached lookup)

Given theme system encounters error
When getCurrentTheme fails
Then fallback default theme is returned
And error is logged for monitoring
And system remains functional

Given performance SLA of 10ms
When getCurrentTheme completes
Then operation time is < 10ms
And memory footprint is < 100KB
And no memory leaks occur on repeated calls

Given concurrent requests for theme
When multiple calls occur
Then all requests return consistent value
And response time remains < 10ms per request
And no race conditions exist
beats.testCase: should have required metadata fields
beats.userStory: As a UI system, I want to retrieve the current theme in <10ms so that theme application happens imperceptibly (target: <5ms for 95th percentile).

beats.name: apply-theme
beats.scenario: Switch Between Light and Dark Theme
acceptanceCriteria:
Given the current theme
When toggleTheme is invoked
Then theme switches to opposite value within 50ms
And new preference is saved to localStorage
And 'theme:changed' event is published

Given animation requirements
When theme toggles
Then CSS transitions are applied smoothly
And no layout shift occurs (CLS < 0.1)
And visual change appears within 100ms total

Given DOM elements with theme-dependent styling
When toggleTheme executes
Then all styled elements update immediately
And CSS variables are recalculated
And no flickering or flashing occurs

Given accessibility requirements
When theme changes
Then color contrast remains >= 4.5:1 for all text
And prefers-color-scheme media query is respected
And system respects 'no-preference' setting

Given performance budget
When toggleTheme completes
Then theme switch completes within 100ms
And no frame drops occur (maintain 60fps)
And memory usage stays within baseline (no leaks)
beats.testCase: should render theme toggle component with light mode by default
beats.userStory: As a user, I want theme switching to complete in <100ms so that dark mode activation feels instantaneous (target: imperceptible transition < 1 frame at 60fps).

beats.name: init-control-panel
acceptanceCriteria:
Given configuration metadata
When initConfig is called
Then configuration is loaded within 200ms
And all fields are prepared for rendering
And validation rules are attached

Given complex nested configuration
When initConfig processes it
Then all nested sections are initialized
And dependencies between sections are resolved
And no circular dependencies cause deadlock

Given configuration with 100+ fields
When initConfig prepares the form
Then initialization completes within 300ms
And form is ready for user interaction
And memory usage scales linearly with field count

Given configuration errors
When initConfig encounters invalid config
Then error is reported with specific issue
And fallback configuration is applied
And system degrades gracefully

Given performance SLA
When initConfig completes
Then Time to Interactive (TTI) is < 500ms
And First Contentful Paint (FCP) is < 1 second
And form is responsive immediately
beats.testCase: exports exist (sanity) and setAllRulesConfig followed by getAllRulesConfig returns the same config object
beats.userStory: As a configuration system, I want initialization to complete in <200ms so that the form is interactive immediately (target: <500ms total TTI per RAIL model).

beats.userStory: As an operations system, I want initResolver to execute reliably with latency < 500ms so that dependent services meet their SLA targets (goal: 99.9% success rate).

beats.name: notify-ui
beats.scenario: Publish UI State Change Notifications to Event System
acceptanceCriteria:
Given a class change operation completes
When notifyUi is invoked with change details
Then an event is published to the central EventRouter within 5ms
And the event contains element ID, action (add/remove), and class name
And the event is stamped with microsecond-precision timestamp

Given multiple class operations occur in sequence
When notifyUi publishes events
Then events are queued in FIFO order
And subscribers receive events in the order they occurred
And no events are dropped or duplicated

Given a subscriber is registered for UI change events
When notifyUi publishes
Then the subscriber receives the event within 20ms
And the subscriber can act on the notification
And multiple subscribers can consume the same event

Given the event system is congested
When notifyUi attempts to publish
Then the event is queued with backpressure
And the operation does not block the caller
And events are eventually delivered with bounded latency

Given notification occurs during error conditions
When notifyUi is called
Then events are still published for traceability
And error context is included in event payload
And the system can reconstruct the failure chain from events
beats.testCase: exports CanvasPage and register()
beats.userStory: As a distributed system, I want UI state changes to be published as events with <20ms delivery latency so that dependent components stay synchronized and can react to state transitions reliably.
